title: Mailchimp Email Campaign
description: Create and launch your first email marketing campaign with Mailchimp

steps.title: Create Mailchimp Account
steps.description: Sign up for a free Mailchimp account to get started.
steps.instructions: Go to Mailchimp.com and click 'Sign Up Free'. Enter your email, create a username and password. Verify your email address. Mailchimp's free plan includes up to 500 subscribers and 1,000 sends per month.
tips: Free plan is perfect for getting started
Use a business email for professional appearance
Enable two-factor authentication for security

steps.title: Complete Your Profile
steps.description: Add your business information and contact details.
steps.instructions: Click your profile icon → 'Account & Billing' → 'Settings'. Fill in your business name, website URL, physical address (required by law), and phone number. This information appears in your emails.
tips: Physical address is legally required for marketing emails
Use a professional business name
Add your logo to brand your emails

steps.title: Create Your First Audience
steps.description: Set up a list to store your subscribers.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Audience' → 'All contacts' → 'Settings' → 'Audience name and defaults'. Name your audience (e.g., 'Newsletter Subscribers'). Set the default from email and name. Enable double opt-in for better engagement.
tips: You can have multiple audiences for different purposes
Double opt-in reduces spam complaints
Keep audience names descriptive
Enable GDPR fields if you have EU subscribers

steps.title: Import or Add Contacts
steps.instructions: Click 'Audience' → 'Add contacts'. Choose 'Import contacts' for CSV/Excel files, or 'Add a subscriber' to manually add people. Make sure you have permission to email these contacts. Tag contacts for better segmentation.
tips: Only email people who opted in
Clean your list - remove invalid emails
Use tags to organize subscribers by interest
Never buy email lists - it violates Mailchimp's terms

steps.title: Create a New Campaign
steps.instructions: Go to 'Campaigns' → 'Create Campaign' → 'Email'. Choose 'Regular' for a standard email. Name your campaign (internal use only). Select your audience and click 'Begin'.
tips: Use descriptive campaign names for your records
Save campaigns as templates if you'll reuse them
Schedule campaigns for optimal send times

steps.title: Set Up Campaign Details
steps.description: Configure who the email is from and the subject line.
steps.instructions: Fill in 'From name' (your business or personal name), 'From email address', 'Subject line', and 'Preview text'. The preview text appears in inbox previews. Make your subject line compelling but not spammy.
tips: Subject lines under 50 characters perform best
Avoid spam trigger words (Free, Win, Click here)
Use personalization like first name when appropriate
A/B test different subject lines
Preview text should complement the subject line

steps.title: Design Your Email
steps.description: Create an attractive, on-brand email design.
steps.instructions: Click 'Design Email'. Choose a template or start from scratch. Mailchimp's drag-and-drop editor lets you add text, images, buttons, dividers, and more. Keep design clean and mobile-friendly. Add your logo at the top.
tips: Use a single-column layout for mobile compatibility
Keep important content above the fold
Use images sparingly - they slow load times
Include clear call-to-action buttons
Match colors to your brand
Test on mobile before sending

steps.title: Write Compelling Content
steps.description: Craft email copy that engages and converts.
steps.instructions: Write in a conversational tone. Start with a strong hook, provide value (tips, offers, news), and end with a clear call-to-action. Keep paragraphs short. Use bullet points for easy scanning. Include links to your website or products.
tips: Write like you're talking to one person, not a crowd
Focus on benefits, not just features
Use emojis sparingly to add personality
Include social proof (testimonials, stats)
Make unsubscribe link easy to find (it's the law)
Proofread carefully for typos

steps.title: Preview and Test Send
steps.description: Check how your email looks before sending to everyone.
steps.instructions: Click 'Preview and Test' → 'Send a test email'. Enter your email address and send. Check it on desktop and mobile. Look for broken links, formatting issues, and typos. Make any necessary edits.
tips: Send test to multiple email clients (Gmail, Outlook, Apple Mail)
Check on both desktop and mobile
Click all links to verify they work
Ask a colleague to review before sending
Use Mailchimp's inbox preview feature

steps.title: Send or Schedule Campaign
steps.instructions: Click 'Continue to Review' to see a summary. If everything looks good, choose 'Send' (immediate) or 'Schedule' (later). Best times to send: Tuesday-Thursday, 10am or 2pm in your audience's timezone. Monitor results in the Reports section.
tips: Tuesday-Thursday mornings have highest open rates
Avoid Monday mornings and Friday afternoons
Test different send times with small segments
Track opens, clicks, and unsubscribes
Good open rate: 15-25%
Good click rate: 2-5%
Clean inactive subscribers every 6 months
